subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Preliminary statistics from a new on-track injury reporting program showed fatality rates among horses that run on synthetic surfaces are nearly identical to the fatality rates of horses that run on traditional dirt tracks.Synthetic tracks averaged 1.95 deaths per 1,000 starts over the course of the study, compared to 1.96 deaths per 1,000 starts for horses that ran on dirt. Mary Scollay, the program’s developer, said more studies had be done before the effect on safety could be determined.
